item.title: ü¶† Focal adhesions (FAs) -- protein complexes that connect the inner workings of cells to their surrounding extracellular matrix ‚Äì help keep cells in place, enable them to move and facilitate passing of signals between cells. (2/7)

item.title: üß´ Many cellular processes, like cell growth and differentiation, rely on the precisely regulated turnover of FAs, and defects in the structure or function of FAs can lead to cancer or immunological disorders. (3/7)
